intro: Pinalia bogoriensis var. kurokawae, commonly known as the Kurokawa's pinalia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring broad, lance-shaped leaves with a waxy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
